meanings.sent1: She paganised her beliefs after reading about ancient gods.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins were paganised by the local community.
meanings.sent3: The cat paganised the house by knocking over all the plants.
meanings.sent4: His music paganised the crowd, transporting them to another time.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush paganised the canvas with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: To make pagan in character or quality.
meanings.sent1: The festival decorations paganised the town square.
meanings.sent2: The folklore tales were paganised over generations.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gnome paganised the garden with tiny statues.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious fog paganised the forest, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The scent of incense paganised the air, filling the room with exotic fragrances.
